text: Luddho panāyaṃ kālāmā purisapuggalo lobhena abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto pāṇampi hanati adinnampi ādiyati paradārampi gacchati musāpi bhaṇati parampi tathattāya samādapeti yaṃ sa hoti dīgharattaṃ ahitāya dukkhāyā ti
edit: Luddho panāyaṃ kālāmā purisapuggalo lobhena abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto pāṇampi hanati adinnampi ādiyati paradārampi gacchati musāpi bhaṇati parampi tathattāya samādapeti yaṃ sa hoti dīgharattaṃ ahitāya dukkhāyā ti

translations.transtext: Kālāmas, this greedy person, overpowered [and] fully taken up by greed, kills a living being, takes the ungiven [things], goes to other's wife, tells a lie, and makes others do likewise. [When] that occurs, [it is] for uselessness [and] suffering  for a long time.
